systemDescription.name: Bluetooth Connectivity System
systemDescription.description: The Bluetooth Connectivity system in the IVI enables wireless pairing and communication between the vehicle and personal devices such as smartphones and tablets. It provides functionality for hands-free calling, audio streaming, contact synchronization, and messaging integration while enforcing safety protocols to minimize driver distraction.
operatingConditions: Bluetooth signals may experience interference in certain environments

safetyGoals.description: The Bluetooth Connectivity system shall manage hands-free calls with minimal driver distraction
safetyGoals.rationale: Phone call management through Bluetooth interfaces is a common cause of driver distraction that could lead to accidents

decomposedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall provide simplified hands-free call controls optimized for minimal visual attention
The IVI system shall limit complex phone features while vehicle is in motion
The IVI system shall prioritize voice commands for Bluetooth phone operations

safetyGoals.description: The Bluetooth Connectivity system shall not adversely affect other critical vehicle systems
safetyGoals.rationale: Bluetooth connectivity issues or resource contention could impact safety-critical vehicle systems

decomposedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall isolate Bluetooth connectivity processes from safety-critical vehicle functions
The IVI system shall monitor and limit Bluetooth system resource utilization
The IVI system shall manage Bluetooth connection failures gracefully without impacting vehicle operation

hazardAnalysis.description: Complex Bluetooth pairing procedure requiring extended attention
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver attention diverted from road for extended period during device pairing

hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion in complex traffic situation
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver distraction during incoming call management

hazardAnalysis.description: Bluetooth system crash affecting other vehicle functions
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Critical vehicle information display interrupted due to Bluetooth system failure
System lag or unresponsiveness in critical displays due to Bluetooth operations

item.name: Bluetooth Connectivity System
item.function: Enable wireless connection between personal devices and vehicle systems

failureModes.description: Complex pairing procedure requiring extended attention

failureEffects.local: Driver needs extended time to complete pairing
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver attention diverted from road for excessive period
failureEffects.endEffect: Increased risk of collision due to prolonged distraction

prevention: Implement pairing wizard with minimal steps

mitigations.description: Disable complex pairing procedures while vehicle is in motion
Alternative pairing methods using NFC or QR codes

safetyRequirements.description: The Bluetooth system shall disable full device pairing features when vehicle speed exceeds 5 km/h
The Bluetooth system shall limit device pairing procedure to no more than 3 steps with clear feedback

potentialCauses: Insufficient audio feedback for call status
Unclear control affordances for call operations

failureEffects.local: Driver must visually focus on screen to manage calls
failureEffects.nextLevel: Extended glances away from road during call management
failureEffects.endEffect: Increased risk of collision due to visual distraction

detection: Measure visual glance time for call management

mitigations.description: Simplified call management with large buttons and minimal options while driving
Voice control prioritization for call management

safetyRequirements.description: The Bluetooth system shall provide simplified call management interface with buttons at least 15mm in size when vehicle is in motion
The Bluetooth system shall provide voice commands for all critical call management functions

failureModes.description: Bluetooth stack crash affecting IVI functions
potentialCauses: Resource exhaustion due to multiple connections

failureEffects.endEffect: Critical vehicle information displays or controls interrupted

prevention: Implement robust error handling in Bluetooth stack

mitigations.description: Process isolation between Bluetooth and critical IVI functions
Automatic Bluetooth stack restart without affecting other IVI functions

safetyRequirements.description: The Bluetooth system shall be isolated from safety-critical IVI processes with resource protection
The Bluetooth system shall implement automatic recovery from stack failures without impacting other IVI functions

failureEffects.local: IVI system becomes slow or unresponsive
failureEffects.nextLevel: Critical information displays affected by lag
failureEffects.endEffect: Driver distraction or delayed access to important functions

prevention: Implement resource usage limits for Bluetooth operations
Prioritize resource allocation for critical functions

mitigations.description: Resource usage throttling for Bluetooth operations
Background processing for non-critical Bluetooth operations

safetyRequirements.description: The Bluetooth system shall limit CPU usage to no more than 20% of system resources
The Bluetooth system shall defer non-critical operations (like phonebook sync) when system load exceeds 80%

safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System disables complex Bluetooth configuration and pairing operations when vehicle speed exceeds 5 km/h; restricts call management to simplified interface with large buttons

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Voice command prioritization for hands-free operation
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System provides comprehensive voice command set for all Bluetooth phone operations with minimal visual confirmation required

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Sandboxed execution environment for Bluetooth stack
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: Bluetooth stack operates in isolated process space with dedicated memory allocation and resource limits to prevent impact on critical IVI functions

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Fault detection and recovery for Bluetooth stack
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System monitors Bluetooth stack health and automatically restarts components after failure detection without affecting other vehicle functions
System enforces resource usage limits for Bluetooth operations and dynamically prioritizes critical system functions during resource contention

testCases.description: Verify motion lock for device pairing
testCases.testProcedure: Attempt device pairing at various vehicle speeds and observe system behavior
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Full pairing functionality disabled at speeds above 5 km/h

testCases.testProcedure: Measure steps required for device pairing and feedback provided
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Pairing completed in 3 or fewer steps with clear feedback at each step

testCases.testProcedure: Assess call management interface elements while vehicle is in motion
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Call management buttons at least 15mm in size with simplified options

testCases.testProcedure: Test voice commands for all critical call management functions
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: All critical call functions accessible via voice commands with >95% success rate

testCases.testProcedure: Force Bluetooth stack crashes and monitor impact on other IVI functions
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: No impact on critical IVI functions during Bluetooth stack failure

testCases.testProcedure: Inject failures into Bluetooth stack and measure recovery behavior
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Automatic recovery within 5 seconds without user intervention

testCases.testProcedure: Monitor CPU usage during intensive Bluetooth operations
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Bluetooth operations limited to maximum 20% CPU utilization

testCases.testProcedure: Create high system load and observe behavior of non-critical Bluetooth operations
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Non-critical operations (phonebook sync, etc.) deferred when system load exceeds 80%
